text:
Hello,

I am trying to implement Call-to-action in my react website, it just simple download button. I got the embed code from the HubSpot (I have not changed it) and I added to the react component as following:

 `const cta = "<!--HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --> <span> embed code here</span> <!-- end HubSpot Call-to-Action Code -->"  ;`

 Then I use dangerouslySetInnerHTML attribute on an HTML element to add an CTA HTML string inside its content as follow:

 `<div`
      `dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: cta}}`
`></div>`

I can see the CTA button in the page and when I click on it, first it takes me to this url <http://cta-redirect.HubSpot.com|cta-redirect.HubSpot.com>......, then redirect the user to download a file. It seems the user interaction does work fine but there is no things has been tracking in HubSpot Call-to-action page.

I used the call-to-action in our WordPress site and used to work before, now the call-to-action does not work in our WordPress and React sites as well!

I checked the HTML code for both site (WordPress and React app), it seems the call-to-action embed code is rendered successfully.

Any though why the call-to-action does not work? do you think I need to do somethings in HubSpot call-to-action setting?

hi guys I have set a window pop up of email capture on my shopify account using hub spot.

can you please help me to make the window appear any time  a visitor refreshes a store?
